title: Standardize backend error handling on AppError
description:
Error handling is inconsistent across the backend:

1. **Mixed error types**: Some services use `AppError`, others throw generic `Error`. For example, `agent-client.ts` throws generic errors.

3. **Error codes**: Some are descriptive (`PROJECT_NOT_FOUND`), others generic (`INTERNAL_ERROR`). No centralized enum/constants for error codes.

4. **Missing context**: Some errors lack details for debugging.

Fix:
- Audit all `throw new Error(...)` and convert to `throw new AppError(...)` where appropriate
- Create an error codes constants file: `packages/backend/src/middleware/error-codes.ts`
- Review catch blocks that swallow errors — add logging at minimum
- Ensure all user-facing errors go through AppError for consistent API responses
- Add error context/details parameter for debugging in non-production environments

DependencyGraph contains hard-coded color literals that violate the acceptance criteria and cause dark mode rendering failures.

title: Crash recovery should check result.json before requeuing completed coding tasks
description:
When the server is down while a coding agent finishes, performCrashRecovery always requeues the task back to open — even if the agent wrote a successful result.json and committed its work to the branch.

**Current behavior:**
- Server restarts, finds PID is dead (scenario 3 in recovery)
- Calls performCrashRecovery which clears state and requeues to open
- Branch is preserved if it has commits, but the task restarts coding from scratch
- The review handoff is lost

**Expected behavior:**
- Before tearing down the worktree, check for a result.json
- If result.json exists with status success AND the branch has commits, skip re-coding and advance directly to the review phase
- This avoids wasting a full coding cycle when the agent already finished successfully

**Affected code:**
- packages/backend/src/services/orchestrator.service.ts — performCrashRecovery method (~line 514)
- Should read result.json via sessionManager.readResult before removing the worktree
- If successful, call executeReviewPhase instead of requeuing
close_reason: Crash recovery now checks result.json before requeuing: when server restarts with dead PID, reads result.json from worktree; if status success and branch has commits, runs tests and advances directly to review phase instead of requeuing. Added 3 unit tests covering success path, tests-fail fallback, and no-commits fallback.

title: Fix: invokeClaudeCli spawns orphaned zombie processes
description:
## Problem

The `AgentClient.invokeClaudeCli()` method in `packages/backend/src/services/agent-client.ts` (line ~284) spawns Claude CLI processes using `exec()` with shell interpolation. These processes become orphans (reparented to PID 1) when the backend restarts, and are never cleaned up.

### Evidence

On 2026-02-18 we found **43 identical zombie `claude` processes** in Activity Monitor (they show as "2.1.42" which is the Claude Code CLI version). All were stuck running the identical "Planner agent" prompt from `deploy-fix-epic.service.ts` with empty test output. They accumulated across multiple backend restarts.

### Root Cause

1. `invokeClaudeCli` uses `exec()` (line 284) which runs through a shell. When the parent Node process dies (tsx watch restart, crash), the shell may exit but the `claude` child process survives as an orphan to PID 1.
2. There is no process group tracking — unlike `spawnWithTaskFile()` (which correctly uses `detached: true` and `-pid` group kill), `invokeClaudeCli` has no way to kill the full process tree.
3. There is no backend shutdown hook to clean up spawned child processes.
4. The prompt is passed as a shell argument via string interpolation, which is fragile and can cause hangs with special characters or empty input.

### Fix Required

**A) Refactor `invokeClaudeCli` to use `spawn` instead of `exec`** — This matches the pattern already used by `invokeCursorCli`/`runCursorAgentSpawn` (line ~407). Pass the prompt as a direct argv element, not through shell interpolation. This gives direct process control and avoids shell escaping issues.

Before (broken):
```typescript
const child = exec(`claude ${modelArg} --print "${fullPrompt.replace(/"/g, '\\"')}"`, { ... });
```

After (fixed):
```typescript
const args = ['--print', fullPrompt];
if (config.model) args.unshift('--model', config.model);
const child = spawn('claude', args, {
  cwd: options.cwd || process.cwd(),
  stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
});
```

**B) Add a process registry and shutdown hook** — Track all spawned child PIDs in a Set. Register `process.on('SIGTERM')` and `process.on('SIGINT')` handlers in the backend entry point that kill all tracked children. Remove PIDs from the set on process exit.

**C) Add a startup cleanup** — On backend startup, optionally kill any orphaned `claude --print` processes from previous runs (check for processes whose parent is PID 1 with matching command signature).

### Files to modify

- `packages/backend/src/services/agent-client.ts` — Main fix (A + B)
- `packages/backend/src/index.ts` (or main entry) — Shutdown hook registration (B)

### Acceptance Criteria

- `invokeClaudeCli` uses `spawn` (not `exec`) to launch the claude CLI
- Prompt is passed as an argv element, not shell-interpolated
- All spawned agent processes are tracked and killed on backend shutdown
- No orphaned claude processes remain after backend restart
- Existing tests continue to pass

title: Implement global error notification bar component
description:
Replace the current ad-hoc error display with a standardized, app-wide error notification bar that follows industry conventions.

Acceptance criteria:
- Create a reusable  component that renders as a fixed bar at the top of the viewport (below the navbar), similar to patterns used by GitHub, Stripe, and Google Cloud Console.
- Support severity variants: error (red), warning (amber), info (blue), success (green).
- Each notification must have a dismiss button (×) and auto-dismiss after a configurable timeout (default 8s for info/success, persistent for error/warning).
- Support stacking multiple notifications with smooth enter/exit animations.
- Wire the component into the global layout so it is available on all pages (Plan, Execute, Eval, Deploy, etc.) without per-page integration.
- Connect to a centralized error/notification state in Redux so any page or API call can dispatch a notification.
- Remove all existing inline/ad-hoc error display patterns on the Plan page (and any other pages) and replace them with dispatches to the new notification system.
- Ensure the bar is accessible: proper ARIA role='alert', keyboard-dismissable, sufficient color contrast.
- Verify correct behavior in both light and dark themes.
close_reason: Implemented global error notification bar: Redux notification slice with add/dismiss/clear actions, NotificationBar component (fixed below navbar, severity variants error/warning/info/success, dismiss button, auto-dismiss 8s for info/success, persistent for error/warning, stacking with enter/exit animations, ARIA role=alert, keyboard-dismissable), listener middleware for thunk rejections, wired into Layout, removed all inline error displays from Plan/Sketch/Execute/Eval/Deliver phases and ProjectView, added unit tests.
